outline:
1. to put to shame, be ashamed, be disconcerted, be disappointed
    1. (Qal)
      1. to feel shame
      2. to be ashamed, disconcerted, disappointed (by reason of)
    2. (Piel) to delay (in shame)
    3. (Hiphil)
      1. to put to shame
      2. to act shamefully
      3. to be ashamed
    4. (Hithpolel) to be ashamed before one another
kjv_def: (be, make, bring to, cause, put to, with, a-) shamed(-d), be (put to) confounded(-fusion), become dry, delay, be long.
strongs_def: properly, to pale, i.e. by implication to be ashamed; also (by implication) to be disappointed or delayed
